preqs: Students must have passed one of the following before undertaking this unit: AFG2020, ACG2020, AFW2020, ACW2020, ACS2770 or AFS2770.

rules.ruleString: Unit was previously coded {ACS3750, AFS3750, AFW3007%, AFW3750%}
Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ACS2770, AFG2020, AFS2770, AFW2020} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Must be enrolled in course type {10, 41, 50}

time: Summer semester B (starts January) 2017 (On-campus block of classes)

description: This unit builds upon the understanding, knowledge and skills developed in AFS2770/ACS2770 (Cost and management accounting A). The unit covers the theory, background and application of managerial decision making in respect of the following different types of decision making techniques: advanced cost-volume-profit analysis and sensitivity analysis, measuring relevant cost and revenues for decision making, complex activity based costing and management, advanced pricing decisions and profitability analysis, budgeting, advanced standard costing variance calculations, analysis and interpretation, performance management, cost estimation and cost behaviour and scarce resources.
